pageContext.claim: “We were going in the wrong direction. When I came in, we were going down. And now we just hit 4.2 percent, and everyone is saying, how did that happen, right? GDP, 4.2 percent.”
pageContext.analysis: The country was not going in the wrong direction and in fact was in the longest expansion in U.S. history. Trump is bragging about 4.2 percent quarterly growth. Obama achieved 5.2 percent in 2014 one quarter. Trump had promised to achieve four percent annual growth, which is much more daunting task.
